intro: Porana duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux's porana, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
